title: Mathematics Instructional Design Utilizing Mobile Computing Thinking

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced studies and experience in executing high-level projects
context.additional_context: Team-based collaborative learning emphasizing environments with accessible mobile app development tools (Thunkable, App Inventor, etc.)

learning_goals: Learners design and implement a mobile-based calculation game prototype following the 5E instructional model stages.

Learners will apply computational thinking concepts (decomposition, pattern recognition, abstraction, algorithm design) to visualize ≥3 mathematical problems (e.g., graph theory, sequence problems) using block-based programming tools (Scratch, Blockly) and submit results meeting ≥4 out of 5 peer evaluation rubric items.

In 4-person teams, learners will develop 1 interactive educational content item combining middle school-level math concepts (area calculations of rectangles, triangles, circles) with mobile app features (drag-and-drop, animation in GeoGebra or Scratch) and achieve a total score of ≥80 points in peer/instructor evaluations (content accuracy 30%, functionality 25%, creativity 25%, usability 20%).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
